text:
HBS is a great place
to pursue a PhD

because people come
together from very
different backgrounds.

You'll have sociologists,
political scientists,

economists all in
one place studying
how businesses can work better.

The main idea of my research is
looking at the microgeography
of innovation.

In other words,
understanding how very short

distances impact the transfer
of inventions to the market.

What I really enjoy about
working with doctoral students

is the back and forth
in the brainstorming.

It is so wonderful
to learn new things

from my doctoral
students, things
I didn't even get exposed to.

Because they're taking
different courses,

they have other
industry experience,
and they talk to other people.

So it's just so wonderful
to get that engagement
and come up with new ideas.

The really great thing that
makes me super, super proud

is when we as a team can hit
the submit button on a journal
article.
